alert.note: Alert for Inland Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 12:55PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 130 PM EDT... At 1255 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Miccosukee Resort, or 13 miles west of Kendall, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... The Redland, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Miccosukee Resort and The Hammocks. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
